entry.title: Pasta Dough
entry.summary: Pasta Dough can be quite difficult, even though there are only 4 ingredients. It's just about the rolling, keeping it a beautiful texture…
entry.content:
Pasta Dough can be quite difficult, even though there are only 4 ingredients. It's just about the rolling, keeping it a beautiful texture without making it stick to surfaces. This recipe will definitely make people think you know how to navigate a kitchen. I've also made this recipe infinitely scalable, just for ease. Thank me later.

PREP TIME COOK TIME SERVES
15 + Resting time 1-2 Minutes 1 Serving

 

Ingredients

100g 00 Pasta Flour

1 Large Egg

1 Tbsp Extra Virgin Olive Oil

Pinch Salt

 

Method

STEP 1

Mix the flour and salt until combined. Pour onto a clean surface and form a well.

STEP 2

Pour the egg and Oil into the middle of the well, and beat until combined, slowly adding flour until it forms a smooth and combined dough.

STEP 3

Sit in a bowl and rest for atleast half an hour. 

STEP 4

Using a pasta maching or bare elbow strength, roll out the dough and cut into strips.

STEP 5

Fill a pan with very salty water and bring to the boil. Dunk the pasta in and cook for about 1-2 minutes or until light and floating.

entry.title: Tomato Pizza/Pasta Sauce
entry.summary: It hurts me when I see someone using store bought Pizza sauce. Like, its really simple and quick to make, yet it just…
entry.content:
It hurts me when I see someone using store bought Pizza sauce. Like, its really simple and quick to make, yet it just tastes so much better. Just make this, and you'll agree. I promise

 

PREP TIME COOK TIME SERVES
N/A 10-20 Minutes 5-10 Portions

 

Ingredients

1 Can Tomato Pasata or Chopped tomatoes

1 Tbsp Oregano

Pinch Sugar

2 Tbsp Extra Virgin Olive Oil

1 Garlic Clove

 

Method

STEP 1

Heat a pan and add the Olive Oil. Mince the garlic into fine peices and add to pan, stirring until aromatic and light brown.

STEP 2

Once the Garlic is browned, add the Pasata or Chopped Tomatoes and Oregano, stirring for around 5 minutes.

STEP 3

Add the Sugar and Stir for another 5 minutes.

STEP 4

Cut the heat and allow to cool before topping pizza, or mix over pasta until covered evenly.

entry.title: Simple Vinaigrette
entry.summary: Something about a Vinaigrette just completes a salad, turning a bland clump of random vegetables at the bottom of your fridge into a…
entry.content:
Something about a Vinaigrette just completes a salad, turning a bland clump of random vegetables at the bottom of your fridge into a sharp, refreshing side to go along with almost every meal.

 

PREP TIME COOK TIME SERVES
5 Minutes N/A 15-30 Salad Portions

Ingredients

3 Tbsp Lemon Juice 

9 Tbsp Extra Virgin Olive Oil 

 

Method

STEP 1 

Mix all ingredients in a bowl and beat fast until emulsified and smooth.

 

TIP: You can change the quantities of the ingredients, as long as you follow a 1:3 ratio of Lemon Juice to Oil.

entry.title: The best burger sauce
entry.summary: Burger sauce is inherently simple. Four ingredients, yet a burst of flavour that instantly levels up your burger game and will make people…
entry.content:
Burger sauce is inherently simple. Four ingredients, yet a burst of flavour that instantly levels up your burger game and will make people go, "they know how to cook". Its that simple. (Quick tip: use light mayo over normal mayo to save those calories for the actual burger)

PREP TIME COOK TIME SERVES
5 Minutes N/A 5 Burgers

Ingredients

2 Tbsp Ketchup

3 Tbsp Light Mayonnaise 

1 Tbsp American or Dijon Style Mustard

1/2 Tsp Lemon Juice

 

Method

STEP 1 

Mix all ingredients in a bowl, until smooth and emulsified.
